_description: Configuration 2: Partial Blown Lift (Dual Motor DEP)
_architecture: 12 High-Lift Motors (battery, inboard) + 2 Cruise Motors (GT+EM parallel, wingtip)
_units: Imperial (lb, ft, kts, HP) unless otherwise noted

aerodynamics._note: High CLmax values augmented by blown lift from 12 high-lift motors

propulsion._note: 2 cruise motors are parallel hybrid (GT + EM on each shaft)

battery._note: Battery powers high-lift motors and supplements cruise motors during peaks

gas_turbine._note: Two gas turbines (one per cruise motor shaft) for sustained cruise power

generator._note: Not used in parallel hybrid configuration

dep_system.description: Distributed Electric Propulsion: 12 electric high-lift (inboard) + 2 parallel hybrid cruise (outboard)
dep_system.wing_sizing_description: When true, wing area is sized assuming blown lift is available for takeoff/landing, resulting in smaller cruise-optimized wing

folding._note: High-lift motors fold during cruise to minimize drag

gas_turbine.per_motor: One GT per cruise motor shaft

electric_motor.per_motor: One EM per cruise motor shaft (parallel with GT)

cruise_motors._note: Each cruise motor has GT + EM in parallel on same shaft

power_architecture.description: GT + EM (parallel) → Cruise motors (all phases), Battery → High-lift motors (takeoff/landing only)
power_architecture.cruise_motors: Parallel hybrid (GT + EM on same shaft)

mission_requirements._note: Cruise motors use fuel for sustained power; high-lift motors battery-only

performance_requirements._note: Tight requirements enabled by blown lift from 12 high-lift motors

hybridization_profile.description: Electric power fraction for cruise motors (0.0=GT only, 1.0=max EM boost). High-lift motors always battery-powered.
hybridization_profile._note: Cruise motors are parallel hybrid; high-lift motors always electric

_explanation.cruise_motors: GT provides base power, EM adds boost during peaks

fuel_fractions._note: Fuel system for cruise motor gas turbines

weight_iteration._note: Moderate initial guess - hybrid configuration with fuel + battery

takeoff.cruise_motors: ~500 kW from GT + EM parallel (30% EM boost)

climb.cruise_motors: ~500 kW from GT + EM parallel (20% EM boost)

cruise.cruise_motors: ~500 kW from GT only (no EM boost)

landing.cruise_motors: ~250 kW from GT + EM parallel (20% EM boost)

battery_sizing_notes.description: Battery provides power for high-lift motors and boost for cruise motors
energy_requirements: Cruise motor boost: EM power during takeoff/climb/landing
Total much less than pure electric (GT provides cruise base power)
power_requirements: Peak: ~150-200 kW for cruise motor boost + 126 kW for high-lift
Battery sized by power (not energy-limited due to fuel for cruise)

advantages: Maximum blown lift effect (smallest possible wing)
Wingtip cruise motors recover vortex energy
Folding high-lift motors reduce cruise drag
GT provides sustained cruise power (good range)
Battery much smaller than pure electric (only for high-lift + boost)
disadvantages: Two gas turbines (one per cruise motor) add weight
Parallel hybrid per cruise motor adds complexity
design_notes.best_for: Medium range regional transport (300-400 nm) with blown lift efficiency and hybrid power

comparison_to_others.vs_config_1_series: No generator (lighter), but 2 GTs on cruise motors instead
comparison_to_others.vs_config_3_multi_engine: Smaller wing (blown lift), but more complex motor system
